item.title: Why default Go protobuf is slow and how I made a tailored unmarshaller for Remote Write
item.description:
Why default Go protobuf is slow and how I made a tailored unmarshaller for Remote Write Link to heading

When working with Prometheus Remote Write, performance bottlenecks often show up in unexpected places.
In my case, the culprit turned out to be the default Go protobuf unmarshaller.

At high throughput (hundreds of thousands of samples per second), decoding protobuf messages became one of the hottest spots in the profiler. That’s not surprising: the default implementation is general-purpose and built for correctness and flexibility.
But in practice, I only needed to handle a very narrow subset of fields — just enough to process Remote Write messages efficiently.
